channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Defective surfacing/projecting ironwork, 7th January
item.description:
The surfacing is breaking up, leaving ironwork exposed. Potential for danger to bicyclists and damage to motor tyres.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 199 Old Bath Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Inspection cover still defective, 7th January
item.description:
Inspection cover sinking and surrounding surfacing crumbling. This was reported in May and August 2022: why no action?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 201 Old Bath Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Time to replace felled trees, 7th January
item.description:
You felled a fine old tree (lime?) here several years ago. It has not been replaced: why not? At least two others of this wonderful avenue have recently been felled. Is this because they were diseased? Replacements need to be promptly planted, so that the avenue will survive in the long term.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 224 Leckhampton Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drains in road., 7th January
item.description:
The drain on Mill Lane, just after the property called Dormans on the left is totally block, and water is running all along the road. I reported the job directly to the council, I received an email last week saying the job had been closed, But the job / issue has not been fixed. Please can it be fixed asap, and it should be flagged that a job has been closed when not fixed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Dormans Mill Lane, Prestbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole at least 10cm deep and down to road-stone below. Breaking up and leaving rubble in the road. Drains not funtioning, so area has standing water whenever it rains., 7th January
item.description:
Drains not at the lowest point so there is standing water for days on end, this has caused the road surface to break up and horn a large pothole. The hole is now breaking up and leaving rubble on the road which can fly up an is a serious hazard. Outside 163 Hewlett road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Teme Place Teme Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
